trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SEQ_00<tab>Alphinaud draws you close with a whisper.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_TODO_00<tab>Gather information in the Understory.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_TODO_01<tab>Deliver the list of the singer's symptoms and the chunk of meol to Thoarich in the Derelicts.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_TODO_02<tab>Speak with the weeping warbler.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_TODO_03<tab>Report to Alphinaud.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_ALPHINAUD_000_010<tab>(Lady Chai has a very particular sense of beauty, and apparently that extends to how I should dress whilst painting...)
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_ALPHINAUD_000_011<tab>(But this obsession of hers works in our favor. The time I spend indulging these distractions is time you can use to continue your explorations.)

TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_ALPHINAUD_000_012<tab>(For this excursion, I'd like you to delve into the layer below us, and sniff about the military headquarters. I'm sure the Understory has its own tale to tell...)
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_ALPHINAUD_000_020<tab>(Now is your chance to squeeze in another round of reconnaissance. Go─I will cover your absence should the Chais become suspicious.)
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_030<tab><sob> <sniff>
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_031<tab>You...you're one of the bonded, aren't you? Like me?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_032<tab>Please, I need your help! My throat, it's... I can't sing anymore...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_033<tab>I've been making excuses, but it's just not getting any better. If my patron thinks I'm of no use to him, then... <sob>
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_034<tab>I need you to sneak out to the Derelicts and describe my condition to Thoarich.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_035<tab>Here's a list of symptoms, and a hunk of meol to pay for his medicines... Please, I have no one else to turn to!
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_040<tab>...You don't know the Derelicts? It's the mess of shacks and ships right outside Joyous Hall.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_041<tab>That's where the apothecary lives. Or at least, that's what I heard...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_050<tab>Hee hee! You need medicines? Tonics? Potions?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_051<tab>Hmmm, a cure for an ailing voice, is it...?

TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_052<tab>No, no medicine will cure this. Methinks your songbird has a lump in her throat. It must be cut out, excised, and even then the voice may never heal completely.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_053<tab>Hee hee, poor little songbird. Will they kick her from the nest, I wonder? Or simply silence her chirps?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_054<tab>Hoho, your face! You didn't know!? Of the many hopefuls who enter the city, very few are ever seen to leave. Even as corpses...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_055<tab>Oh, you might see one or two fortunate fools hurled from the balconies, but the rest...? Gone.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_056<tab>A town of nightmares, it is. Not for this ship's rat, oh no no. I am content to scurry around down here, and nibble on the crumbs which fall from the table.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_057<tab>This consultation is over! You have my verdict, and I have my meol! Good day!
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_THOARICH_000_060<tab>All the old hands, they know, oh yes, they know. They just don't like to talk about it. Wouldn't want to upset the status quo, hee hee!
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_070<tab>D-Did you get my medicine...?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_071<tab><sob> ...So that's it? What am I to do if I can't sing...?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_072<tab>Ah, there you are, my sweet canary. Have you been crying again? Don't tell me your voice is still not on the mend...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_073<tab>Oh, generous sir, have mercy! I've done all I can, but even the apothecary said...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_074<tab>...So you've been suffering all this time?

TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_075<tab>I am sorry, my pet. I hadn't realized your affliction was this grave... But you needn't fret! I'll not reward your hours of trilling by casting you out into the street!
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_076<tab>You are too kind, sir...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_077<tab>But what use am I if I cannot sing? I fear the day I become more burden to you than treasure...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_078<tab>Then I shall have a word with Lord Vauthry, and arrange for your ascension.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_079<tab>In that paradise where resides neither pain nor illness will your song ring out clearly once again.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_080<tab>...Or mayhap you think it a step too far?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_081<tab>No, I... You would do that for me!?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_082<tab>Of course. Why, I would almost wish to hasten my own ascension, knowing your blessed instrument was waiting there to greet me.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_Q1_000_083<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_A1_000_084<tab>Ascension...?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_A1_000_085<tab>Sounds too good to be true...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_086<tab>Ah, you must be a new arrival. Allow me to explain.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_087<tab>Ah, you must be a new arrival to harbor such doubts. Allow me to allay your suspicions...

TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_088<tab>As all know, the sin eaters exist to devour the sinful. But also do they serve to gather the souls of the innocent, and shepherd them unto celestial paradise.

TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_089<tab>It is through Lord Vauthry that we learned this truth. It is through Lord Vauthry's grace that the free people of Eulmore are destined to embrace salvation.

TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_090<tab>We are blessed to spend our days surrounded by love and merriment, until at last we are called to our final rapture. Even the bonded may find a place within that host, should their patrons deem them worthy.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_SINGER03289_000_091<tab>Lord Vauthry truly is a great man, isn't he?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_GENTLEMAN03289_000_092<tab>Now if you will excuse us, we must be on our way. May you find eternal salvation for the compassion you have shown my precious canary.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_DULIACHAI_000_100<tab>Oh, dearest, we really should have found you some new gloves.
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_CHAINUZZ_000_105<tab>Yes, my love, you're probably right...
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_ALPHINAUD_000_110<tab>'Tis good to see you back. You were taking so long I began to worry something had happened.

TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_ALPHINAUD_000_111<tab>I've begun sketching an outline for the portrait, but...nay, the Chais appear otherwise occupied. Will you share what your investigations have gleaned thus far?
TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_ALPHINAUD_000_112<tab>So...Lord Vauthry boasts some manner of influence over the sin eaters, does he? That would explain the reverence in which he is held by the citizenry.

TEXT_LUCKMA208_03289_ALPHINAUD_000_113<tab>And as for this “ascension” business, I cannot help but be put in mind of that apothecary and his ominous remarks. If so many folk have entered the city over the years, then where do they go...?
